properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 10:12PM CST until February 6 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Lincoln IL
properties.description:
...Accumulating Snow and Ice Wednesday Afternoon into Thursday...

.Snow will overspread much of central Illinois Wednesday
afternoon, with a mix of sleet and freezing rain south of a
Shelbyville to Danville line. Precipitation will continue
Wednesday night and into Thursday, with snow accumulations of
2 to 4 inches for much of central Illinois, with isolated 5 inch
amounts near the Illiois River Valley. The wintry mix will keep
snow totals under 2 inches south of a Shelbyville to Danville
line, with ice accumulations possibly over one tenth of an inch
near the I-70 corridor.

* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations
of less than 2 inches and ice accumulations of around one
tenth of an inch.

* WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast Illinois.

* WHEN...From noon Wednesday to noon CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the evening commute Wednesday and
morning commute Thursday.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the
Internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST THURSDAY
